#Text=Get a Sponsor for Sound Offs
#Text=If you have an affinity for cars , marketing , and audio equipment , you might be interested in learning how to get a sponsor for sound offs .
#Text=Sound offs are competitions in which cars demonstrate their custom-built audio systems and compete for titles and prices .

#Text=Getting a sponsor for sound offs involves a lot of research , precision , and hard work , but can pay off by getting your car a state-of-the-art sound system and the sponsors a lot of exposure .
#Text=Read the following steps to find out how to get a sponsor for sound offs .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Design the sound system for your car .
#Text=Unless you already have some celebrity status in the automotive or audio industry , you should approach a respected car audio store to help you select the products and design the system .
#Text=Research potential manufacturers of each part of the audio system .
#Text=Try to find at least 2 candidates for each part .
#Text=For each manufacturer , carefully list the model number of the product you need , as well as the contact details of the marketing director of each company .
#Text=Create visual plans of the audio system .

#Text=Make them as clear as possible by drawing the layout of your car , and then creating additional layers ( if you 're using computer graphics ) or transparencies ( for paper ) for the hardware and wiring .
#Text=Create a portfolio of your own work , including a resume , publications , awards , and other noteworthy details .
#Text=If you have a logo , include it .
#Text=Write up a marketing plan that outlines how , when , and where the car 's sound system will get coverage .
#Text=Substantiate your plan with letters of interest from publishers , producers , and event managers .

#Text=Draft a cover letter that outlines your motivation for undertaking this project , a description of the audio system , what you want from each manufacturer , and what type of coverage they 'll receive in return .
#Text=Ask for a reply to your request within a time period that works for you .
#Text=An acceptable time frame is 14 days .
#Text=Assemble a package for each manufacturer that includes a cover letter , the visual plans for the audio system , your portfolio , and the marketing plan .
#Text=Send a package to the marketing director of each company .
#Text=To ensure timely delivery , it 's recommended to use priority shipping .
#Text=Follow up with each manufacturer after 2 weeks to find out whether they are willing to sponsor you .
#Text=Negotiate the details of each sponsorship agreement to find a deal that works for both parties .
#Text=Sign the sponsorship agreements .
#Text=If you 're unsure about the terms and conditions of the agreements , have a lawyer explain them to you before you sign anything .
#Text=Tips
#Text=After getting a sponsor for sound offs , follow your contract and keep the sponsor informed of your project 's progress .
#Text=Use the names of your sponsors to get maximum exposure in the media .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Sound system design
#Text=List of manufacturers and product model numbers
#Text=Visual plans
#Text=Portfolio
#Text=Marketing plan
#Text=Cover letter
